''We should hit Khurmal during the speech, given that Colin Powell will talk about it.'' Khurmal is the name of a village near the site. In his U.N. presentation, Colin Powell described it as Terrorist Poison and Explosive Factory, Khurmal. Donald Rumsfeld said Khurmal was operated by Ansar al-Islam, a Sunni militant group with ties to Abu Musab al-Zarqawi , a Jordanian extremist with ties to the al-Qaida terrorist network. night Sergio Marchionne knew he had a winner. ''I got e-mails after the Super Bowl at 10 or 11 at night from Chrysler employees saying they've never been prouder to work for Chrysler,'' he said. And these are from people who have been here 20 or 30 years. That's why Sergio Marchionne is smiling. He admits that it's great to get everyone talking about Chrysler, but it won't mean anything if his company can't turn that buzz into sales. That
